question: Organic and oxidizable inorganic substances in the sample are oxidized by
The amount of oxygen consumed by sewage as a result of an oxidizing agent such as potassium dichromate is referred to as

answers.a: At which the reaction is heated depends on the boiling points of the solvents
answers.b: At which the reaction is heated depends on the boiling points of the solute
answers.c: At which the reaction is heated depends on the boiling points of the solution
answers.d: At which the reaction is heated depends on the boiling points of the mixture

answers.a: Amount of oxygen required for growth of microorganisms in water
answers.b: Amount of oxygen required to oxidize the calcium present in waste water
answers.c: Amount of oxygen that would be removed from the water in order to oxidize pollution
